Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dana-Popescu
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel in Rome was pretty good considering the price. The room was clean, but pretty small, also (as another user mentioned) TV only had Italian programs; but on the other hand you don't go to Rome to spend all your time in the hotel room. Breakfast was good, actually better than expected. One downside would be that it was pretty noisy, but this could have been due mostly to the fact that our room was close to the stairway, and you could easily hear people when they were going up and down the stairs (this is not a good thing, especially if you have trouble sleeping). The staff was ok. Transportation to city center was also very good. Close to the hotel you can find a bus station, from which you can take bus 542 to Bologna metro station (and from there 3 stations to Termini or 5 stations to Colosseum) or bus 61 also to Bologna metro station or to Barberini metro station. Taking a 3 day pass that costs 11 euros (one trip costs 1 euro), for both metro and bus, is a really good deal. All in all, this is a good hotel, considering the good price, and if you don't like busy areas like Termini.

Reviews.Title: “too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: this was supposed to be a romantic break as it was our honeymoon, but we didnt get that. Walls are very thin! our room was between a family with a yelling child . The child cried all the time and was in and out of both rooms and up and down the corridor. Next they disappeared and a party of students arrived and these were even worse, no control what so ever! shouting screaming, banging doors, in and out of each others rooms, by 2am my husband had enough and opened the door and told them all to be quiet as people trying to sleep! The night staff did nothing my husband went down to ask him to do something about it and he was asleep on the sofa covered up!! The good point is that it is clean with plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Guenstiges Hotel fuer Rom Trip mit guter Verkehrsanbindung”
Reviews.Author: Jeanny13
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel 10 minutes from Bologna metro station by foot and than only 5 metro stops from Colosseo where all the sightseeing starts. Cleaniness is ok and the walls are fairly thin. I could hear the neighbor snore so bring your ear plugs. Rooms are decent size, big bathroom. For a sightseeing trip where you don't spend much time in the hotel perfect. The cheap price makes it well worth it. Breakfast is small but good. Free internet. You have a televison but only italian except MTV sometimes in English.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: mc0z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Osimar Hotel for the weekend when visiting Rome to explore the sights. The hotel is located in a residential neighbourhood. It is a ten minute walk from Bologna Metro Station. It is a healthy walk from the sights, approximately 40 minute walk from the Colosseum and over an hour (approx 8 km) walk from Vatican City, so in staying here, you need to be comfortable taking metro lines or walking quite a distance. The hotel is clean and simple, no frills. The breakfast is basic, continental style. For what we paid it was a positive experience. Shuttle service was offered to and from the airport for a good price. Staff was pleasant. A note to the ladies: bring your own hairdryer, the one supplied takes quite a while to do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome good Price”
Reviews.Author: LEB1952
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and quiet with a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice with GREAT nearby restaurant”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: Sep/Oct 2011. Stayed one night at the beginning of our trip and two at the end. Staff very friendly and although the rooms were in need of a little redecoration, they were very clean with comfortable beds and working TV, Fridge etc. Staff very accommodating when we requested additional pillows. Nice continental breakfast.Ten minute walk to Bologna Metro station - easy enough to find if you have a map and the hotel sell the metro tickets. BIG BONUS is a new local restaurant (2 mins walk) Rosso Liziano - this is not a 'tourist' restaurant. The pizza's are HUGE and really really good, as are the seafood pasta dishes and the mushroom risotto - the best evening meals of our 10 day trip. Their menu items have really funny English 'translations' such as 'porky mushroom' and 'hypocrite steak on the grate' but the food is delicious and cheap (as is the house red wine). From the hotel door: turn right up to the street, turn right again and walk approx 50 metres to the main road - Rosso Liziano Restaurant is on the opposite side of the road, diagonally to the left. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, basic hotel with fresh continental breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: Lots of one way streets in vicinity so hotel was a little difficult to find in the dark! Weather was very hot so took the 61 bus into Rome (15minutes) or to piazza Bologna to pick up the metro. Bus stop to go into Rome: Turn left past small supermarket then right at road end, bus stop is next to rubbish recycling bins (not smelly!). On way back to hotel 61 bus via Rodolfo LANCIANI - 2 stops one just as bus turns into street and best one just before Q8 garage. From 2nd bus stop turn right before garage and hotel on left 100 metres..

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca T
Reviews.Content: My father and I spent 3 nights in Rome at the Osimar Hotel and we both had a fabulous time! We were made to feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble! I was concerned about the location when making my reservation but there was no need to worry as the nearest Metro Station is a short walk away and the network is 'foolproof'. We discovered an amazing Pizzeria round the corner from the Hotel (I think near 'Piazza M Armellini') it's very popular with the locals so I'd reserve a table to avoid disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Tricked and Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: S M
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the location of the hotel. From the description it sounded like it was minutes from the Trevi fountain and other sites in Rome. However, it was a good hour by foot and local transportation to get to anything worth seeing. The hotel is located in an isolated area without other businesses or hotels near. All 6 times we took a taxi or car services they got loss locating the hotel even with a gps since it is in an obscure area. Also staff gave us maps but failed to tell us the logical route was impossible to take due construction. We got lost every night and wasted a lot of time trying to get directions to a location no one had ever heard of. The room itself was ok, as long as you don't mind sticky floors and a leaky shower. That seems to be typical of Europe so we could have lived with that inconvenience if we weren't already cranky from getting lost every day. Breakfast was limited and serving staff had resentment issues towards the guests. After scolding me like a small child for not knowing how to use the coffee machine that had no directions the waitress reinforced her disappointment by angrily and loudly slamming everything as she replenished the supplies. Just what you want to hear early in the AM.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeniLovers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the centre and a 10 min walk to the metro. Basic and clean, can't comment on breakfast as we didnt make it in the morning. Staff excellent and very helpful. What did make it for us was the restuarant at the end of the road called 'rosso...' across the dual carriageway.... food amazing and the service excellent... nice to get away from the bizz at night. Also lots of nice cafe's and the locals were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lumac23
Reviews.Content: The Osimar Hotel treated us very well during our stay in Rome. It wasn't as close to the Colisseum as we would have liked, but a quick Metro ride took us to everything. There are some restaurants nearby, but one evening it was hard to find one. We stumbled into one late and had a fabulous meal. The desk staff was tremendously helpful, writing on maps to help us get to where we needed. In the evening, the hotel was quiet and restful. It is in more of a suburban area with apartments and was peaceful and not overly noisy.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and they have great service”
Reviews.Author: noevia
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and is very cozy and very family-friendly. It has great comfort and the rooms were very clean and organized. Theres nothing more I can say besides the fact that it was a great experience staying with Osimar and that the waitress named Mariuxi that we met was excellent with us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Miky198
Reviews.Content: We stayed a long weekend here in may. Clean room was not too big not too small. Good for couples. Not very bright, but that helps in the hot summer. Tv about 200 channels - only in italian Oops! Clean bathroom fully equiped, eg hairdryer, bidet Great cleaning service - you will get your towels changed every day even if u stay for 2 nights and new soaps. Breakfast very ok to us, all the different types of croissaints, juice, jam, nutella etc plus some ham, cheese, etc. Coffee/tea machine to your disposal. Location was nearby metro Bologna station, few minutes walk, not bad at all - you will get everywhere you want by metro or bus. Good service - will help you to plan your visit tell you where to go and how to get there, give you maps, indications. Near the hotel there is a paid indoor pool, might be good for summer. Not sure if any can go there, but lots of parents with kids were coming.

Reviews.Title: “Our Roman Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MauiPigFarmer
Reviews.Content: After having travelled across Italy for almost two weeks our family of 4 arrived at the Osimar Hotel having taken the overnight train from Venice to Rome . . . the slow train. The one that stops at EVERY single station along the way. Our thinking was that we would catch some sleep on the overnight train and then drop our bags at the hotel and finish our last day in Italy sightseeing and shopping. Boy was that a bad idea. We googled the walking directions from Tiburtina station and they seemed a bit convoluted, so we emailed the hotel for more specific directions and were told to take bus 309 to the end of the line (XXI Aprile) and then walk 5 minutes. At eight in the morning after you've been up all night those might not be specific enough instructions. We spent a while asking for directions, looking at the google map on the phone, etc. We finally arrived at the hotel and the manager greeted us by name when we walked in. He let us know that he would be happy to store our bags, but that if we wanted to step into the breakfast area and eat he would have our (quad) room ready within the hour. He let us know a few minutes later that they weren't able to have the quad room ready that early, but he had two double rooms that were waiting for us for no additional charge if we wanted to get showered and get some rest we could go right up. We didn't even let him get the offer out of his mouth all the way before we were climbing the stairs to the rooms. We all showered and slept the better part of the day. I'm not sure we would have made it otherwise. We didn't wander out for food until about 5pm or so. The rooms themselves were VERY quiet. VERY clean. They had everything we needed, including shampoo, conditioner, in-room safe and mini-fridge. We couldn't have been happier with the accommodations. The manager suggested that we might consider an airport shuttle instead of lugging our baggage back across the city to Termini and catching the Leonardo Express. We actually ended up paying around the same amount but with much less wear and tear on our bodies / nerves. I appreciated his suggestion. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. The staff was so accommodating, and they could see immediately how very weary and exhausted we were the minute we hit the door. The manager's kindness almost brought me to tears that morning. Yes, it's off the beaten path and a little more difficult to find but I promise it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: leezee86
Reviews.Content: *Room average looking, not too big not too small... Great for couples. *Not very bright, tiny window, which is a minus but if you intend to do a lot of sightseeing you wont mind... *With all the ameties! *Tv about 200 channels - only in italian Oops! *Bathroom fully equiped, eg hairdryer, bidet *Great cleaning service - you will get your towels changed every day even if u stay for 2 nights and new soap even if u touched it once which is a bit...weird.. *Breakfast ok, all the different types of croissaints, juice, jam, nutella etc etc. yum :)) *Coffee machine to your disposal, dont be scared by lady staring at you but remember dont press too many buttons coz someone is watching your fingers 'THE MILK IS HERE!!!' (not nice). *'Garden Area' weird looking... fake leafs all over.. BUT HEY GREAT VALUE SO WHO CARES. *Location Location Location! nearby metro Bologna station, few minutes walk, not bad at all - you will get everywhere you want by metro or bus (nite link stops just around the corner if u want to stay longer in the city centre -bus&metro 1 euro!!!) *Be sure to pass the Gellateria near the piazza bologna on your way to metro... and ask for banana flavour seriously!!! :) *Great service - will help you to plan your visit tell you where to go n how to get there, give you maps, even order pizza!!! - I have to say - Especially the polish guy (Dont remember his name sorry) very friendly and extremely helpful!!! *The rest of the staff... hmmm not very interested in guests will do what they get paid for, nothing more.. !!!AND A BAD BAD THING!!! You will surely forget everything that's nice in that hotel... room 104 having broken AC that starts at 5am every morning and will wake the dead... Complained 3 times, they just said they cant knock nor ring at this hour!!! dont mind that everyone else cant sleep!!! noone could fix or switch it off - horrible drilling through the wall. You can always sleep on the couch in reception... Good Luck! *Would definitely come back for the price and location! But asked for a different room even in the middle of stay being cheeky if something like that happend again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple :)”
Reviews.Author: Zortren
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel that can change ur expectations in a good way, for me I came thinking it wasn't too good but when after re first day I felt it was really really nice, too bad is kinda far from some tourist places. Service is great the people are always willing to help out

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, affordable hotel with great transport links”
Reviews.Author: Serpentine_queen
Reviews.Content: As a couple with a child who is just 22 months, it was important to us to be close to the city as it would be asier for us and less tiring for our son when going out each day. There are 4 busees which you can take to the nearest metro, or walk the 900m if you wish. The Metro and buses bring right into the city in the areas where all the sights are. There are also many restaurants and take-aways in the area, handy as the hotel has a bar but no restaurant onsite. We took advantage of these and found the food better and cheaper than Ireland. There are also 2 supermarkets in the vicinity as well. The room was clean, a little small, and made up each day for us. It had a fridge, but unfortunately no tea making facilities. Also no microwave in the hotel so we had to warm our baby's food by standing it in hot water each day. You might want to bring a travel kettle. The complimentary toiletries and shower caps were a nice surprise, and the bathroom was spotless which was the first thing I checked when I walked into the room. All in all, I would say we had a very comfortable stay and would suggest that management consider providing tea making facilities as this would be a nice plus considering there is no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Oxinja
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small, very old fashioned and is located quite far from the city centre, but quite close to Bologna Metro station. We requested a double bed, which was two single beds put together, so wasnt very comfortable.TV had no English channels, but it didnt really matter much as we didnt spend much time in the hotel. Breakfast was prettly basic continental - ham, cheese, fruit, cereal, buns, sweet pastries, juice..Coffee was the best part - really delicious even though it was from the machine. We found receptionists quite unfriendly.. All in all, really basic hotel.. the bathroom and the room were clean. And by the way, Wi FI connection was free and really fast! We didnt pay much, so couldnt really expect too much either.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBenp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a good place to stay for a budget break to rome. Its location is good but very hard for taxi drivers to find, 3/4 of ours had never heard of it. The staff were quite friendly. Breakfast was chesse ham and yougurts. Rooms are small but cleaned well and the shower was nice and powerfull. The hotel has a restaraunt 2 mins away for dinner and it is very good and well priced if you are on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better !!”
Reviews.Author: darren_of_Tonbridge Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The photograph of the rooms was not as the website, to be honest I question if it was the same hotel! 'Run down, most certainly not soundproof as described and the toilet flush broke as soon as I touched it', There was a mini bar in the room which I put a few snacky items of my own in the fridge, these seemed to mysteriously dissapear after the cleaner had been in!, The pillow was wafer thin So I asked for another one, and kept on asking untill the day I checked out! there was grit on our carpet which remained throughout our stay, maybe the maids should be shown a hoover! It seems that I am just moaning, I really dont want to, Having said all the above The lady who prepares the breakfast really should consider a career change, RUDE, is not the word, If looks could kill! 'Ask for a coffee and she clearly didnot want to get it, 30 mins later and a chat with her colleagues, then maybe you would get it, the bread and croisants were stale, she seemed to favour the Italians when a group of Italians went up to get some croisants she appeared with some fresh ones for them and suggested they put the other ones back, which they did after they had all been man handled. In the short time I was there I saw one guy at the reception moaning that his door was hanging off, One guy moaning that the safe did not work, and one lady complain that there was no hot water in her room. Me and my partner was clearly not the only ones with issues! I am sorry to be a moaner, I really would like to find some good words to say!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job nicely, not fancy but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: MikeJLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my 60+ inlaws, wife and 2 year old to Rome and stayed in Osimar for 4 nights. It was quite far from the airport and yes it isn't central but it isn't bad at all. The area it is located in has some nice restaurants, good shops and it is only a 10 minute walk to the nearest underground station which can get you in to the centre in about 10 minutes. The hotel itself is quiet, the service functional (noone is overly friendly but not rude-somewhere inbetween) and breakfast is great-lots to eat and drink in continental style. A taxi ride to most places of interest in Rome is about 15 Euros one way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: moominmobile
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here based on the remarks left on this website. This is a genuine 3* hotel. It is not in the heart of the city (10-15 min walk NE from Bologna Metro station) but it is remarkably good value for such a well maintained hotel. The number 61 bus stops on Via Rudolph Lanciani, about 3 mins away from the hotel. this is useful if you want to take the bus into the city centre rather than walk to Bologna Metro. Nomentana Rail station is a good 15-20 minutes walk away from the hotel. You may choose this if you come in from Fiumencino Airport, as this is on the same line, meaning you do not need to worry about changing trains and losing your bearings. The hotel is situated in a quiet residential street, surrounded by apartments. It is not on the main road and as such it is lovely and quiet. There is a municipal swimming pool next door. The main impression from from walking into the lobby is of a very smart, modern hotel. It is clearly well kept and maintained. The small dining area for breakfast has an outside terrace attached for al fresco breakfasts (continental style: ham and cheese, rolls, yoghurts, juice, coffee). The rooms are generously sized, very very clean and well maintained. The double I stayed in had a huge bed. The walls and carpets and bedding are all very clean. the bathroom also is excellent, with a good shower (no bath) and bidet. The room has airconditioning (a must!) - you may need to ask at reception to switch it on when you arrive. Also a TV which has cable (BBC World) and a mini fridge too. Having stayed in Milan before in a supposedly 3* hotel and was extremely disappointed for its shabbiness and poor maintenance, it would seem this hotel is keen to buck the trend. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Osimar Hotel - Nice and Simple”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: a simple 3 star hotel. I booked it through lastminutetravel, where you get the name of the hotel after you book, so I couldn't check up on it. I knew the location would be good, and that was enough since we didn't plan to spend much time at the hotel. The location was indeed good, not right in the center of the city (I was mostly looking for something nice and quiet, not in the center of everything), though I understand why that would bother someone who wants to go out right downtown. The distance using the metro was good for us. The rooms were ok, and the staff was great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: traveller987654Uk
Reviews.Content: worst experience ever. Hotel was overbooked (despite reservation and confirmation about booking), so we were sent to another hotel (4km away) at night, which had no breakfast buffet (as booked), not wireless Internet and was in a very bad neighbourhood. This all happened after we had "checked in" and had already paid by credit card (so it was hard to say no afterwards!) Try to avoid this hotel as apparently a reservation does not mean anything and they treat guests like [--].

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: snoopcat
Reviews.Content: Sorry to hear that the previous review had such a hard time but faced no such problems with the Osimar. It was a few minutes walk form the tube but the neighbourhood was pleasant and the staff were really freindly and helpfull. Being just out of the centre it is more tranquil and as the rooms are all new they were in pretty good condition and comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate and would stay again at the Osimar simply because of the excellent rates on offer. Public transport is cheap and pretty efficient so seeing the city was no problem from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel dumped us a block from the train station without any information.”
Reviews.Author: lingua5
Reviews.Content: We had booked at the Hotel Osimar back in August for a trip in November. After spending €60 to get there from the Airport, we were promptly told that they had some sort of "problem with water" on the first floor and they had transferred us to a different hotel. They called a cab and paid for the trip to the next hotel. The only problem was that they didn't tell us what the other Hotel was called, and the cab driver didn't know where it was. After 30 minutes of driving around, he pulled over by the Radisson a block from the train station and dropped us off pointing vaguely in the direction of the Radisson. We check at the Radisson and they didn't have our reservations, but were kind enough to call the Osimar and get information on the hotel where we eventually stayed, it was two blocks away from the Radisson. The Hotel Mamiani is where we ended up which was a small, quiet, clean hotel where you can't drink the water out of the sink (they have signs posted). The Hotel Mamiani wasn't bad in general, but not what we had booked, nor what we paid for, the rate didn't change just because the hotel did. I recommend highly against the Hotel Osimar because of thier "dumping" policy. p.s. - A Big "Grazie!" to the desk clerks at the Radisson for sorting this mess out for us.

Reviews.Title: “Careful with thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDodo3
Reviews.Content: The room was overall decent and modern. Breakfast not great but ok. The major downside was that the hotel was quite far from the center. Although it says that it's just one station away from the Termini; you still need to walk to the tube station for about 15 minutes, and take the metro for about 5 stops to actually get to touristic attractions. The other problem was that walls were very thin. I could hear the guy in the other room snoring at night. It felt we were all sleeping in the same room, which was very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sly_racoon
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel. Staff were very friendly and breakfast was great. A short walk from Bologna Metro station which is only 3 stops away from the centre of Rome. The only downside is that the rooms are not very soundproof, you can hear most conversations from the room next door although this is typical of most hotels these days.

HotelInfo.Name: Osimar Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Felice Grossi Gondi 87 | angolo Via Rasponi, 00162 Rome, Italy
